What is known about “Pengpai / 澎湃 OS / HyperOS” and Xiaomi’s AI

  • Xiaomi now uses HyperOS (also called 澎湃 OS / Pengpai OS) as its unified OS for mobile, replacing MIUI. (Wikipedia)
  • Xiaomi markets HyperAI (an AI subsuite) on its global site: it says the OS is “embedded with Google’s deeply customized AI assistant” and supports multimodal (text, audio, image) AI assistance. (Xiaomi)
  • The “AI Writing” feature is a part of HyperAI: it can help with extending, proofreading, polishing emails / articles / notes, summarization etc. (Xiaomi)

So Xiaomi’s direction is that their newer OS will include AI writing/translation support integrated at system level.

  • Xiaomi supports eSIM in many of its newer phone models (but only if the hardware + firmware support it). (Xiaomi)
  • As for hardware AI / models: Xiaomi has recently released its own AI large language model named MiMo (7B parameter model) for reasoning tasks. (South China Morning Post)

So Xiaomi is building the ecosystem where phones run AI models / reasoning locally (or offload) under their OS.

What is uncertain or conditional

Even though Xiaomi plans / claims many of these features, whether your specific unit (Xiaomi “Pengpai AI” / 澎湃 OS) in Hong Kong can do all these depends on region, hardware, firmware versions, and restrictions.

Specifically:

  • Gemini (Google’s AI model) — Xiaomi says its global AI assistant is “deeply customized” from Google’s AI assistant as part of HyperAI. But whether full Gemini integration (all features, latest updates) is available in HK units is not publicly confirmed. (Xiaomi)
  • Google services (GMS) — For abroad / global / non-China ROM versions, Xiaomi usually includes Google services (Play Store, etc.), but if the ROM is the Chinese / China variant, Google services may be omitted. It depends on which ROM is installed.
  • eSIM — Even if hardware supports it, often the region / firmware / carrier must permit it. Some Xiaomi units globally have eSIM, some do not, and some users report needing to change region settings to enable the eSIM toggle. (For example, one user of Xiaomi 15 Global says they had to set the region to Europe temporarily, enable eSIM, then revert region. (Reddit))
  • AI for essays / translation / conversation — Because HyperAI claims those capabilities, it’s likely your device will have them — if your firmware / model supports them. But features may be limited or restricted (e.g. languages, cloud vs local, usage quotas).
